item.title: Chantelle Diachina, E-RYT & Founder of Prana
item.dc:creator: chantelle

item.title: About
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
We specialize in corporate yoga and well-being in the workplace. Within our society we continue to observe stress levels steadily increasing and our health and happiness steadily decreasing. The Prana team feels it is time to take the famed Eastern wisdom approach of mindfulness, positive psychology and self-care and make it practical and accessible to everyone. We currently offer on-site yoga classes in corporate spaces and privately in client homes. All of our teachers are registered with the Yoga Alliance and/or Canadian Yoga Alliance and are fully insured. We also offer "off-the-mat" professional development seminars, workshops and team retreats focused on the promotion of self-care and mental wellness as a means to build resiliency to stress.  

Meet Our Stress Managers

LAURA JOHNSON REGISTERED YOGA TEACHER (R.Y.T.) Laura came to yoga because she thought it would make her stronger during a time when her body was weak– and it did, but it didn’t stop there. Over time she realized yoga was also making her a better human. She received her 200 hr Yoga Teacher Training from The Lotus Centre in London, ON in 2010. Since then, her practice and teachings have deepened through trainings with Master Yoga teachers such as Todd Norian (Ashaya Yoga - Touch of Grace Hands-on Adjustments Teacher Training), Sadie Nardini (Core Strength Vinyasa Yoga - Revolution Teacher Training) as well as Brenda Dowell (DevaTree School of Yoga - Beyond the Basics; Advanced Asana Teacher Training) to name a few. She continues to strive to live and breathe yoga each moment through the good times and bad times, while holding on to the teachings that have molded her thus far. It is an approach that keeps her grounded, balanced and happy. Laura is registered with the Canadian Yoga Alliance  and you can also catch a class with her at Karma Yoga Studio.
KIM ELLIG PICKEN BEd REGISTERED YOGA TEACHER (R.Y.T.) After a few yoga classes at a local community centre, Kim knew she finally found a fun, physical activity that was easy on her joints, alleviated anxiety, and helped her learn how to relax! Also an educator, Kim has spent most of her career as a Learning Support Teacher, specializing in supporting students and families in trauma and/or struggling with social-emotional and mental health issues. Soon Kim's passions for teaching, yoga and improving physical and mental health began to evolve into a career beyond the educational system. In 2012, Kim received her 200 hr Yoga Teacher certification from Maha Pura Yoga Studio in Guelph, ON and is registered with Yoga Alliance. You can take interdisciplinary hatha yoga classes with Kim through her company, Mother Nurture Yoga & Wellness, which serves the Strathroy and surrounding areas.
GABRIELLE RICKMAN REGISTERED YOGA TEACHER (R.Y.T.) Gabrielle has been practicing yoga for eight years and obtained her 200-hour level yoga teacher certification in December 2012 from Deva Tree School of Yoga.  Since that time, she has been teaching a cross-disciplinary approach to yoga in her private and semi-private yoga classes. Gabrielle is registered with the Canadian Yoga Alliance  and continues to expand her knowledge through additional yoga teacher trainings with the intention of being able to provide her clients with the most fulfilling yoga experience possible. In addition to being a certified yoga teacher, Gabrielle is a certified holistic health and wellness coach. With a strong passion for helping others, Gabrielle uses yoga, yogic philosophy, and health coaching with her clients to bring health and vitality back into their minds and bodies with reduced stress, increased energy levels, and continued support to create and maintain balance in their lives. CHANTELLE DIACHINA BEd, MEd EXPERIENCED REGISTERED YOGA TEACHER (E-R.Y.T.) & PRANA FOUNDER Yoga came into Chantelle's life in 2001, while living in Brampton, ON.  Chantelle's  first yoga teacher was from India and was taught yoga as a child by her grandfather. What Chantelle thought was just another form of exercise, quickly became so much more. As a survivor of domestic violence, Chantelle experienced first hand the incredible healing power yoga has on the mind, body and soul. She also noticed she was sick with colds and flu less often and was better prepared to face the stresses of day to day life. After more than a decade of being a classroom teacher, Chantelle left teaching to pursue her passion for yoga. In 2007, she traveled to Miramar, Florida to study under Master Yogi Hari Sukhu of the Sivananda lineage and receive her 200-hour yoga teacher certification. Not sure if she made the right choice, Chantelle continued to teach a few yoga classes but returned to school a year later and received her certification in Public Relations and Communications from Fanshawe College. She was immediately hired upon graduation with digital agency, rtraction, as their client relations manager, but it only took a few years before yoga called her back. From colleagues asking her for yogic advice on personal life issues and how to loosen tense muscles to being requested to teach private group classes and speaking about workplace wellness for a Regional Mental Health Care Lunch and Learn at St. Joseph's Hospital, Chantelle realized there was a high need for yoga and effective stress management in the workplace. In January of 2013, Chantelle left rtraction and began to pour her heart and soul into creating Prana Yoga & Wellness, which officially launched in October 2013 and she hasn't looked back since. Chantelle is registered as an experienced yoga teacher with Yoga Alliance. Chantelle also offers classical hatha yoga classes through Forest City Sport & Social Club, Downtown Yoga Holistic Centre and at her private home studio. Twitter: @paisley_girl73 Blog: neverwateraweed.blogspot.ca

item.title: What's New
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Welcome to our new website! Since launching Prana in October, we've already began to receive positive feedback from our current corporate clients:
I am having a great week and I do attribute some of that to my breathing.  The staff absolutely love the yoga and I think it is making a huge difference.  We can’t thank you enough.
We've also been invited to speak at University of Western Ontario for the Introduction to Human Resource Management Continuing Studies Program, as well as to the Techalliance Women in Technology Peer to Peer group... and our client base continues to grow! Thank you to the London business community for being receptive and giving such a warm welcome to Prana. We are also excited for our founder, Chantelle Diachina, who is currently in India to continue her yoga studies (and for a little family traveling adventure!) She looks forward to sharing what she has learned with our clients.

item.title: Workplace Wellness
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
In the last decade, much attention has been paid to increasing physical activity and supporting healthy eating in the workplace. While these are good places to start, when it comes to true wellness, Prana believes emotional and mental fitness also plays an important role. The World Health Organization (WHO) agrees. They have defined positive mental health as “a state of well-being in which every individual realizes his or her potential, can cope with normal stresses of life, can work productively and fruitfully and is able to make a contribution to his or her community. In the workplace there can be no health without mental health.” WHAT WE OFFER While there is no magic pill or quick fix, the Prana team has tools to offer that when practiced over time will help your employees build resilience to stress, thereby promoting and protecting your team’s well being. We offer both "on-the-mat" and "off-the-mat" services for executives and staff in your corporate space. Choose our services individually or combine them for a complete workplace wellness package:
  • Yoga classes in the office before or after work and/or during the lunch hour
  • 8-week "Live & Learn" stress management course focusing on mindfulness, positive psychology, relaxation methods and breathing exercises
  • Seminars, workshops, retreats related to work-life balance, mental-emotional wellness, stress management and self-care.
  • 30-minute Mindfulness classes
All of our programming is created with the intention of providing professionals with tools to help them better manage stress in their lives and to feel happier at work and in life:
"I attended two of Chantelle’s wellness workshops at a Fanshawe College faculty retreat day and they were extremely well done. The combination of Chantelle’s skills as a teacher / facilitator and her passion for yoga were evident throughout the sessions, and it was an enlightening and positive experience for all of the participants. After attending both wellness workshops, I was motivated to take Chantelle’s yoga classes. Chantelle really makes her students feel welcome, and she fosters an environment where her students feel safe trying new poses. Chantelle is also very encouraging when she sees our progress, and she makes us feel successful in our own practice. I am new to yoga and find I look forward to every Wednesday evening and my time with Chantelle. I feel more relaxed and centered after each class, and I also find I’m often reflecting on something she said during our class that really resonated with me. I believe my life is changing is positive ways because of Chantelle and all that I'm learning from her. " -Jackie W.
WHY IT'S IMPORTANT In January of 2013, The Canadian Standards Association (CSA) Group released the new National Standard of Canada on Psychological Health and Safety in the Workplace in response to some compelling statistics on how chronic stress, anxiety and depression are affecting working Canadians. It is estimated that Canada spends $51-billion per year on absenteeism, productivity, indemnities and healthcare as a result of mental health disorders. These new standards will play an important role to employers wishing to achieve the rank of “top employer” and implement best practices. By implementing an approach to workplace wellness that targets stress management and overall well-being, organizations can more effectively:
  • recruit and retain employees
  • increase productivity and profit
  • reduce costs related to employee sick leave, health plan expenses and workers' compensation and disability claims
  • build a stronger team and boost morale
  • control costs due to employee absenteeism and “presenteeism”*
*presenteeism is a term to describe employees who are physically at work, but due to stress are highly distracted and mentally preoccupied, which greatly affects productivity.

item.title: Yoga
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Our approach to yoga is simple: Whether you are a beginner or seasoned yogi, we are here to serve you. We want to watch your progress and be there to celebrate your milestones. It’s important to us that we learn how your body moves, that you are confident while practicing yoga alone or in a group, and that you feel comfortable asking us questions and providing feedback. There are many different styles of yoga available today. What we offer is classical hatha yoga, which is a great foundation for all other styles of yoga. Our classes are designed with a core sequence of postures that are used by all our teachers so you can experience progress, mastery and the full relaxation benefits of your practice. As your practice progresses, more variations and new asanas (poses), as well as other styles of yoga are introduced. What? No studio? Nope. In true yogi fashion we are not fixed to one space. We have the ability to teach yoga wherever you are: at home, at the office or at a park. All of our teachers also instruct classes with other local studios if you prefer a studio group experience. CORPORATE YOGA Looking to de-stress at work? Our Prana Yoga teachers are here to help. We offer 60-minute on-site classes which are ideal before work, during the lunch hour or after work. It’s a great team building activity, too! (Pssst... if your employer won't subsidize the classes, self organize and divide the cost between you and your colleagues!) Fees: $75 + HST per class (up to 15 people, $5 per person for 16 or more people); minimum 12 week session required.   PRIVATE YOGA CLASSES Maybe you don’t feel comfortable practicing in a group setting, would like the time-saving convenience of having yoga classes in your home or you wish to deepen your practice and knowledge. Our private yoga classes are a good choice for you. We will come to you* for one-on-one yoga classes or make it a social event and invite some friends and family members to join you. Our private classes are ideal for 1-6 people. *If you are interested in private yoga classes, but do not have the appropriate space, we can make arrangements for studio space. Additional fees may apply. We offer the following: # of Sessions        Cost per class*: 60 mins        90 mins Single class                                          $80                 $110 8 or more weekly classes                  $75                 $105 *Prices do not include HST. STUDIO GROUP CLASSES All of our teachers also teach at other studios throughout the local area. Here’s where you can catch a group class with our yoga teachers, experience other styles of yoga and support other local yoga studios: Chantelle Diachina (Classical Hatha Yoga; Vinyasa) Downtown Yoga Holistic Centre, Fridays 12:00-1:00pm Forest City Sport & Social Club (FCSSC) Wednesdays evenings (time varies per session) Kim Ellig-Picken (Pre & Post Natal Yoga; Interdisciplinary Hatha) MotherNurture Yoga Laura Johnson (Hot Yoga & Vinyasa) Karma Yoga Gabrielle Rickman: (Power Yoga & Interdisciplinary Hatha) BeBalanced Yoga

item.title: Work/Life Balance???
item.dc:creator: chantelle
item.content:encoded: Many of us have been conditioned to keep work and personal life separate and have been failing miserably. Now we are convinced if we just achieve work/life balance we would be better off. The problem is we are still separating the two. Let me make this clear: There is no such thing as work/life balance. There is however, "life balance". Life balance entails an understanding that your life has a beginning, which we'll call "Point A" and it has an ending, which we'll call "Point B". Everything in between these two points is your life; work included. To have life balance has everything to do with how you move between point A and B and nothing to do with taking minutes and hours from this basket over here and putting more minutes and hours in that basket over there. The latter is way too stressful– trust me, I know! No... Life balance begins with you. It begins with committing to take care of yourself, to learn how to breathe, sleep, eat and move better. It's desiring to have a good quality of life as you approach Point B, which begins now. It will involve stripping away some unnecessary things in your life: be they excessive, counterproductive to your well-being or clearly a waste of your precious time. This is your life and as an adult, you are it's one and only custodian. Stop wasting time worrying about how to do it all. Instead, start making some tough calls (a.k.a. sacrifices) and practicing mindful self-care.  The rest will follow. Chantelle is the founder of Prana Yoga & Wellness. She does the necessary work to remain happily married and to be a positive role model to her two school age daughters. Things you may not know about Chantelle: she once was lost in Thailand but was saved by a random motorcyclist from California; hearing her children fight irritates her to no end (does lack of sleep); she once showed up to a potluck party on the wrong night– she brought her dish to share, though!
